SENT.plain: A 67-year-old man with adenocarcinoma of the colon had recurrent pulmonary emboli
The patient's level of serum antithrombin III was found to be below normal
Heparin therapy led to further reduction, resulting in failure of adequate anticoagulation
The patient subsequently died of massive pulmonary emboli despite heparin therapy
We believe the antithrombin III level should be routinely determined for patients receiving heparin therapy
